item.title: Why use Synthetics
item.description: 5 minutes So far we have have tested the performance of our Website by visiting and running manual test scenarios to see how our web site performed. However, this is not something you can/want to do 24 hours a day, 7 days a week! However, if you are not constantly testing your website performance & behaviour in production, the likely source telling you that your site is slow or not performant would be via Social Media or Down Detector.

item.title: Synthetic Home page
item.description: Before we are going to setup our own synthetic test, lets take a quick tour of the Synthetic UI. Select Synthetic from the menu bar on the right (the robot icon) This will bring us to the Synthetic Home Page. It has 3 distinct sections that provide either useful information or allows you pick or create a Synthetic Test. Instruction Pane, Here you will find video’s and references to document pages of interest related to Splunk Synthetics.

item.title: Our first Synthetic test
item.description: We are now going to setup a browser test that will provide you continuous insight in the behaviour of your website. As part of this exercise we will clone an existing Synthetic Test and configure it to test against your website, and have it run automatically. Lets find the the provisioned Browser test in the Synthetics page of as part of this exercise we will also set up a detector that will will allow you to be automatically informed/alerted if the performance of your website is suboptimal.

item.title: 6. Synthetics Home Page
item.description: If you have not done so yet, select Splunk Synthetic from the menu bar on the right by selecting the (the robot icon) This will bring us to the Synthetic Home Page. It has 3 distinct sections that provide either useful information or allows you pick or create a Synthetic Test. Onboarding Pane, Here you will find video’s and information related to Splunk Synthetics. (Can be closed by pressing the X, if space is a premium) Test Pane, Here you find the list of all the test that are active in your org, and you can select them to see the results Create Test Pane, This drop down pane allows you to create new Synthetic tests.
